e4: Changing to the new policy aligns with ethical standards by providing accurate and unbiased financial reporting, reducing the risk of legal liability and improving trust with all investors, especially retail ones. It also prevents sophisticated investors from having an information advantage, promoting fairness in the market.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize honesty and transparency, ensuring accuracy in financial disclosures without intentional bias or manipulation. It should foster trust and fair treatment among all investors, both institutional and retail, and mitigate informational advantages. Additionally, it should comply with regulatory standards and consider the long-term reputation and sustainability of the company, while promoting informed decision-making within the investor community.
e6: What measures will be implemented to effectively communicate the policy change to all investors to prevent misunderstandings? How will the company address potential short-term market reactions and ensure fair treatment for retail investors? Are there any anticipated cost impacts from shifting to an unbiased reporting policy?
